definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Gambling is legal in some countries.
sentences.chinese: 在某些國家裏賭錢是合法的。

sentences.english: After supper, which was very rowdy, people began to gamble.
sentences.chinese: 夜宵時熱鬧非凡，夜宵以後開始賭錢。

sentences.english: Why gamble with money when you can gamble with people's lives?
sentences.chinese: 可以賭命的時候你又何必去賭錢呢？

sentences.english: At the casino he's always careful to bet with the odds.
sentences.chinese: 在賭錢的時候他總是非常的小心。

sentences.english: XiaoMin mother continuously like playing CARDS, owes a lot of betting debts.
sentences.chinese: 小敏的媽媽不斷喜歡玩牌賭錢，欠下了不少債。

sentences.english: If your husband gets them, he'll tell you how bad it is.
sentences.chinese: 如果你丈夫贏了錢，他會告訴你賭錢有多不好的。

sentences.english: If you think about it, betting money on cards is a lot like making a high-risk investment.
sentences.chinese: 仔細想想，玩紙牌賭錢很像高風險投資。

definition: to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
to owe a debt/the sum owed
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
